snippet: Four decades later, the Media, Pa., burglars come in from the cold.
abstract: Brent Staples Editorial Observer column describes how 1971 burglary of Federal Bureau of Investigation office in Media, PA, led to stronger oversight of agency after documents stolen showed extent of its domestic surveillance program; notes burglars' identities are only now revealed in book The Burglary: The Discovery of J Edgar Hoover's Secret FBI by Betty Medsger; laments that Americans are less protected today from unjustified spying than they were during the 1970s.
lead_paragraph: Four decades later, the Media, Pa., burglars come in from the cold.
